alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 4:23PM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, DeWitt, Karnes and Lavaca. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2.0 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuero, Yoakum, Kenedy, Karnes City, Hallettsville, Yorktown, Shiner, Runge, Nordheim, Hochheim, Thomaston, Westhoff, Ezzell, Sublime, Edgar, Concrete, Arneckville, Terryville, Meyersville and Hope. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
